dmca.title: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Classmates Online,Inc.'s IP on FindLostClassmate.com Webs
dmca.body:
_____  

From: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
[mailto:abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com] On Behalf Of McGuane, Tara
Sent: Wednesday, February 15, 2006 6:25 PM
To: qqebiz@gmail.com
Cc: abuse@theplanet.com
Subject: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of Classmates Online,Inc.'s IP on
FindLostClassmate.com Website



Dear Sir or Madam:

Inre:  FindLostClassmate.com eBay Auction No. 7590825298    

We are writing in response to the attempted eBay auction of the
FindLostClassmate.com website, your unauthorized use of the CLASSMATES
registered trademark in your domain and on your site, and the unauthorized
use of Classmates Online's copyright protected material on your website's
homepage.

As you probably know, Classmates Online, Inc. ("Classmates Online") owns and
operates the popular website,  <outbind://14/www.classmates.com>
www.classmates.com, the leading online community that connects more than 40
million members with friends, family, military and work colleagues.
Classmates Online also owns the exclusive trademark rights for
CLASSMATES.COM (Reg. No. 2,584,325), and CLASSMATES (Reg. Nos. 2,758,007 and
2,755,056) in the United States and internationally. Classmates Online has
made a substantial investment in developing and providing its services and
has acquired a tremendous amount of goodwill and brand equity in the
CLASSMATES name. As we hope you can appreciate, Classmates Online is
concerned that your unauthorized use of the CLASSMATES registered trademark
on your site and in your domain name may cause confusion as to whether you
or your company's activities are authorized, endorsed or sponsored by
Classmates Online when, in fact, they are not. 

Additionally, your website includes the following phrase "Leap through a
portal to the best of your past. Rediscover the people, places, and pop
culture of your youth" on its homepage. Classmates Online uses this phrase
extensively in its advertising and gained copyright protection for this
phrase in 2001, Copyright Reg No. TX 5-508-975. 

International and US federal laws protect against the unauthorized use,
sale, or offering for sale a domain name which infringes another's
trademark. Infringers who have been notified of such infringing activity,
but do not cease their infringements, may also be considered "willful" and
could be subject to monetary damages. Having received this e-mail, you are
on such notice. 

While we understand that you may have registered the above domain name and
developed the FindLostClassmate.com website without full knowledge of the
law in this area and Classmates Online respects your right of expression and
your desire to conduct business on the Internet, we must enforce our own
rights in order to protect our valuable and famous trademark(s). For these
reasons, and to avoid consumer confusion, Classmates Online must insist that
you cease development and sale of competing websites which incorporate the
use of the CLASSMATES registered trademark and copyrighted material and
transfer the FindLostClassmate.com domain name to Classmates Online. 

By providing you with this notice and clarifying Classmates Online's rights,
we trust that you will promptly cease your unauthorized use and that we may
each continue to pursue our businesses and interests without necessity of
legal action. 

Sincerely, 
______________________________
Tara McGuane
IP and Marketing Compliance Manager
Classmates Online, Inc., A United Online Company
2001 Lind Avenue SW, Suite 500
Renton, WA 98055
T: 425.917.4777
F: 425.271.5595
TMcGuane@corp.untd.com
This transmission is intended for the sole use of the individual(s) to whom
it is addressed and may contain information that is proprietary, privileged,
attorney work product or otherwise exempt from disclosure. Please contact
the sender if this transmission is received in error and immediately delete
this message and its attachments from your system. Unauthorized use is
prohibited.
